unnormalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Renewable Energy Sector Gains Momentum**
normalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Renewable Energy Sector Gains Momentum**

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – The Indian renewable energy sector is witnessing substantial growth, driven by government initiatives and private investments. Recent data indicates a 15% increase in solar power generation in the last quarter alone.
normalised: New Delhi, India – The Indian renewable energy sector is witnessing substantial growth, driven by government initiatives and private investments. Recent data indicates a fifteen percent increase in solar power generation in the last quarter alone.

unnormalised: The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) announced plans to commission a 500 MW solar park in Rajasthan by December 2024. This project is expected to provide clean energy to over 200,000 households in the region.
normalised: The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) announced plans to commission a five hundred megawatt solar park in Rajasthan by December two thousand and twenty four. This project is expected to provide clean energy to over two hundred thousand households in the region.

unnormalised: Furthermore, a consortium led by Tata Power secured a Rs. 3,500 crore contract to establish a wind energy project in Gujarat. The project, spanning 500 km, will further boost India's wind energy capacity.
normalised: Furthermore, a consortium led by Tata Power secured a rupee three thousand five hundred crore contract to establish a wind energy project in Gujarat. The project, spanning five hundred kilometer, will further boost India's wind energy capacity.

unnormalised: Experts predict that the increased adoption of renewable energy sources will significantly reduce India's carbon footprint, aligning with the nation's commitment to combat climate change. On this auspicious occasion of Onam, a time for new beginnings and prosperity, it is pertinent to note that sustainable development through renewable energy forms the bedrock of a greener future for India, just as flavorful biryani represents the diversity of Indian cuisine. IIT-Madras is also spearheading research into advanced battery storage solutions to support the grid integration of renewable energy.
normalised: Experts predict that the increased adoption of renewable energy sources will significantly reduce India's carbon footprint, aligning with the nation's commitment to combat climate change. On this auspicious occasion of Onam, a time for new beginnings and prosperity, it is pertinent to note that sustainable development through renewable energy forms the bedrock of a greener future for India, just as flavorful biryani represents the diversity of Indian cuisine. I I T-Madras is also spearheading research into advanced battery storage solutions to support the grid integration of renewable energy.
